snippet.title: Commuters going without to get to work
snippet.description:
* Every day, Jennifer Bonchak commutes 64 miles round trip from her home in Raleigh, North Carolina to her job at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
http://www.cnn.com/2008/LIVING/worklife/07/23/cb.going.without/index.html

snippet.title: Drivers, bicyclists clash on road sharing
snippet.description:
* Professor Peter Furth has ridden his bicycle to work at Northeastern University each day for the past six years. The two-mile trip through the Boston suburb of Brookline, Massachusetts, is usually without incident.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/LIVING/05/11/bicycle.wars/index.html

snippet.title: Your e-mails: Cutting extras, essentials
snippet.description:
* Gas prices are rising, seemingly unstoppable on their way to an average $3 gallon, and the peak vacation driving season is still ahead. On Wednesday, oil prices jumped above $72 a barrel to set another record after a government report said supplies of crude made a surprise decline and gasoline stocks fell far more than expected.
http://www.cnn.com/2006/US/04/19/feedback.gasprices/index.html

snippet.title: 7 ideal summer road trips
snippet.description:
* Summer in the U.S. and Canada is all about road tripping. Here are 7 of our favorites, some well known, others following country roads that only locals usually travel. All of them have plenty of room for improvisation.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/TRAVEL/06/03/summer.road.trips.matador/index.html

snippet.title: CNN Washington AM Note
snippet.description:
* NATIONAL STORIES: CNN: Federal investigators called in as Colorado firefighters make progress As hundreds of firefighters began to get the upper hand on a huge blaze near Colorado Springs, Colorado, investigators stepped up their probe into the cause...
http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2013/06/17/cnn-washington-am-note-78/

snippet.title: 9 great Memorial Day getaways
snippet.description:
* Thinking about taking a break for Memorial Day?
http://www.cnn.com/2011/TRAVEL/05/25/memorial.day.getaways/index.html

snippet.title: Port deal draws debate, Bush promotes renewable energy
Bush vs. 'Bubble Boy'
snippet.description:
* We were worried yesterday that we'd gone too far in our reporting on Teresa Heinz "Shove it!" Kerry. Little did we know that we'd be writing this morning about John Kerry's "Bubble Boy" photo-op, pictures of President Bush picking his nose and cheerleading at Yale, and a 1975 quote in which Teresa called Ted Kennedy a "perfect bastard."
http://www.cnn.com/2004/ALLPOLITICS/07/27/tues.day/index.html

snippet.title: Blue-collar workers latest group to be sucked into the Web
snippet.description:
* Greg Hosford's afternoon job is a quick one. He sticks his head under a car's dashboard, wielding an electric screwdriver to loosen the stereo housing. "This should be pretty easy," he says, yanking off a plastic faceplate. Thirty minutes later he's installed a new unit.
http://www.cnn.com/2000/TECH/computing/06/06/blue.collars.online.idg/index.html

snippet.title: Homesickness: A holiday primer
snippet.description:
* When I was a young boy growing up on the mean streets of Philadelphia, I was convinced that it was the most ghastly place a person could possibly live.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/12/22/travel/homesickness-guide/index.html
